page.title: 03TRAFFIC COUNT
page.content: Traffic count.Thursday 4 July 1985 1:48p.m.-2:36p.m.Number of cars using lane =45,. vans=6 bicycles=4 and 2 mopeds.Bakers lane is a minor narrow country road.It is used as a short cut between Braiswick and Lexden roundabout.Passing under Baker's bridge is British Railway track.Trains running from Liverpool Street London to Colchester and beyond.Train count during same day was as follows:5 trains going to London,3 trains coming from London.A12 dual carriageway traffic 1:47p.m.-2:30p.m. 53 cars, 50 lorries, 2 army trucks, 2 army lorries coming from London. Towards Ipswich = 47 cars, 7 vans, 3 coaches, 40 lorries, a motorbike, a caravan. Weather conditions were sunny and hot.
